intro: Osbeckia tenuis, commonly known as slender osbeckia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine pubescence. The flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators.
